member.name: T:NDAPIUnity.GloveController
member.summary: Manages a specific physical glove and its communications. The NDController class instantiates one GloveController for each glove connected to the system. This class is derived from MonoBehaviour, so it works as a component attached to a GameObject. At the moment of instantiation, the NDController class instantiates an empty object, attaches a GloveController component and then starts it after configuration.

member.name: T:NDAPIUnity.HapticMixer
member.summary: Haptic mixer. Stores a track for every user of the glove. Mixes their values in order to calculate the output of a channel, taking the highest.

member.name: M:NDAPIUnity.HapticMixer.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:NDAPIUnity.HapticMixer.AddTrack
member.summary: Creates a new track.
member.returns: The id for the new track.

member.name: M:NDAPIUnity.HapticMixer.DisableTrack(System.Int32)
member.summary: Disables the track.

member.name: M:NDAPIUnity.HapticMixer.GetChannelValue(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the channel mixed value given its id.
member.returns: The channel value.

member.name: M:NDAPIUnity.HapticMixer.SetChannelValue(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Adds a value to the given track and channel.

member.name: M:NDAPIUnity.HapticMixer.SetToZero
member.summary: Set all HapticTracks and its channels to zero

member.name: T:NDAPIUnity.HapticTrack
member.summary: Haptic track. Stores a value for each channel. Every object using a glove has an assigned track in the HapticMixer used by the GloveController.

member.name: M:NDAPIUnity.HapticTrack.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:NDAPIUnity.HapticTrack.Get(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the value from a specified channel.

member.name: M:NDAPIUnity.HapticTrack.Set(System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the value for a specified channel.

member.name: M:NDAPIUnity.HapticTrack.Disable
member.summary: Disables the track.

member.name: T:NDAPIUnity.NDController

summary.para: Manages all gloves connected to the system and provides the controllers required to access them.

In order to use a glove you have to request the appropiate glove controller to the NDController class, which has static calls to retrieve a controller or a list of controllers. It also has methods to check if any of the connected gloves is performing a contact action.

member.example:
Example of use:
HapticControler hc = NDController.GetController ();

member.name: M:NDAPIUnity.NDController.OnApplicationQuit
member.summary: Gets the ApplicationQuit event. Sets every actuator channel to 0.

member.name: M:NDAPIUnity.NDController.OnDestroy
member.summary: Gets the Destroy event. Sets every actuator channel to 0.

member.name: M:NDAPIUnity.NDController.LateUpdate
member.summary: LateUpdate is called after the animations but before rendering, OnGUI and ending events

member.returns: An array with the ids for every connected device.

member.returns: The number of connected devices or an Error enum.

member.summary: Gets an HapticController for every connected glove. The returned HapticControllers are instatiated when called, so use this method just when needed.

member.param: The array where the HapticControllers will be saved.
member.returns: 0 if succeeded, otherwise an Error enum

member.summary: Gets the default HapticController regardless the hand. Use in case you just need a controller, no matter which hand or glove.
member.overloads: Returns a controller for a glove.
member.returns: 0 if succeeded, otherwise an Error enum

member.name: M:NDAPIUnity.NDController.GetController(System.String,NDAPIUnity.HapticController@)
member.summary: Returns a HapticController for the given serial key.
member.overloads: Returns a controller for a glove.
member.returns: 0 if succeeded, otherwise an Error enum

member.name: M:NDAPIUnity.NDController.GetController(System.Int32,NDAPIUnity.HapticController@)
member.summary: Returns a HapticController for the given glove id.
member.overloads: Returns a controller for a glove.
member.returns: 0 if succeeded, otherwise an Error enum

member.name: M:NDAPIUnity.NDController.GetController(NDAPIWrapperSpace.Location,NDAPIUnity.HapticController@)
member.summary: Gets the default HapticController for the selected hand. Use in case you just need a controller for that hand, no matter which glove.
member.overloads: Returns a default controller for a glove.
member.returns: 0 if succeeded, otherwise an Error enum

member.name: T:NDAPIUnity.HapticController

summary.para: Class used to communicate with a glove, it has all the calls needed to send and retrieve data to and from the glove.

A glove can be accesed by many different users ( "users" in this case can be understood as different classes that can access to the glove at the same time), so the glove controller needs to manage all the calls to work properly. In order to do it, it has a track for every user; this way it can mix the values it receives. When any user requests access to a glove, the system creates a new track and returns a custom HapticController object with a reference to the assigned track.

member.name: P:NDAPIUnity.HapticController.Location
member.summary: Returns the glove hand. The glove can be right-handed or left-handed.
member.value: The glove hand, Right ot Left.

member.name: M:NDAPIUnity.HapticController.#ctor(NDAPIUnity.GloveController)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:NDAPIUnity.HapticController.Clone
member.summary: Clones the instance of this HapticController. The clone has a reference to the same glove controller as the original, but also a reference to its own track in the glove controller. This way the values sent to the clone won't interfere with the ones sent to the original, and their values will be mixed by the glove controller.

member.name: M:NDAPIUnity.HapticController.PlayValue(NDAPIWrapperSpace.Actuator,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the actuator value. The value won't change until this method is called again. If there is somebody else setting the value to the same glove and actuator, the higher value will prevail.
member.returns: 0 if succeeded, otherwise an Error enum

member.name: M:NDAPIUnity.HapticController.PlayPulse(NDAPIWrapperSpace.Actuator,System.Single,System.Int32)
member.summary: Plays a pulse in the given actuator during the given time. After that time, the actuator value returns to its previous value. If the current value is bigger than the pulse value, it won't play.
member.returns: 0 if succeeded, otherwise an Error enum
